intro: Alyssum huetii, commonly known as the Mexican alyssum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in spring. Alyssum huetii is often grown as an ornamental plant for its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders.
